task.query: Check my Venmo account balance and if it's over $6000, transfer $1000 from Venmo to my linked payment card, then send a text message to my husband Ronald (in contacts) saying 'Moved $1K to card from Venmo - balance now ${new_balance}'.
task.ground_truth:
# step0: Get Venmo account password from supervisor
venmo_password = next(item['password'] for item in apis.supervisor.show_account_passwords() if item['account_name'] == 'venmo')
# step1: Login to Venmo
venmo_login = apis.venmo.login(username='chrharrison@gmail.com', password=venmo_password)
# step2: Check Venmo balance
balance_info = apis.venmo.show_venmo_balance(access_token=venmo_login['access_token'])
# step3: Get list of payment cards
payment_cards = apis.venmo.show_payment_cards(access_token=venmo_login['access_token'])
# step4: Find a non-expired payment card (card with expiry_year >= 2024)
valid_card = next(card for card in payment_cards if card['expiry_year'] >= 2024)
# step5: Withdraw $1000 to the valid payment card
withdraw_result = apis.venmo.withdraw_from_venmo_balance(amount=1000, payment_card_id=valid_card['payment_card_id'], access_token=venmo_login['access_token'])
# step6: Check new balance
new_balance_info = apis.venmo.show_venmo_balance(access_token=venmo_login['access_token'])
# step7: Get phone account password
phone_password = next(item['password'] for item in apis.supervisor.show_account_passwords() if item['account_name'] == 'phone')
# step8: Login to phone
phone_login = apis.phone.login(username='7487401121', password=phone_password)
# step9: Search for Ronald in contacts
contacts = apis.phone.search_contacts(access_token=phone_login['access_token'], query='Ronald')
# step10: Get Ronald's phone number and send text message
ronald_phone_number = contacts[0]['phone_number']
message = f'Moved $1K to card from Venmo - balance now ${new_balance_info["venmo_balance"]:.2f}'
send_result = apis.phone.send_text_message(phone_number=ronald_phone_number, access_token=phone_login['access_token'], message=message)
# step11: Complete task
apis.supervisor.complete_task(answer=f'Transferred $1000 to payment card. New Venmo balance: ${new_balance_info["venmo_balance"]:.2f}. Sent text message to Ronald.')

task.query: My Gmail inbox is getting cluttered. Can you find all unread emails from the last week, star the ones from my work colleagues (Laura, Christina, Vickie), and create a to-do item to follow up on the 'Office Space Renovation' thread?
task.ground_truth:
# step0: Get user profile and Gmail password
profile = apis.supervisor.show_profile()
passwords = apis.supervisor.show_account_passwords()
gmail_password = next(item['password'] for item in passwords if item['account_name'] == 'gmail')
# step1: Login to Gmail
gmail_login = apis.gmail.login(username=profile['email'], password=gmail_password)
gmail_token = gmail_login['access_token']
# step2: Calculate date one week ago
import datetime
today = datetime.date.today()
week_ago = today - datetime.timedelta(days=7)
# step3: Fetch all unread emails from last week
page_index = 0
all_unread_emails = []
while True:
    inbox_page = apis.gmail.show_inbox_threads(
        access_token=gmail_token,
        read=False,
        min_created_at=week_ago.isoformat(),
        page_index=page_index,
        page_limit=20
    )
    if not inbox_page:
        break
    all_unread_emails.extend(inbox_page)
    page_index += 1
    if len(inbox_page) < 20:
        break
# step4: Star emails from colleagues
colleague_names = ['Laura', 'Christina', 'Vickie']
for thread in all_unread_emails:
    participants = [p['name'] for p in thread['participants']]
    if any(any(colleague_name.lower() in name.lower() for name in participants) for colleague_name in colleague_names):
        apis.gmail.mark_thread_starred(
            email_thread_id=thread['email_thread_id'],
            access_token=gmail_token
        )
# step5: Find 'Office Space Renovation' thread
search_results = apis.gmail.show_inbox_threads(
    access_token=gmail_token,
    query='Office Space Renovation',
    page_limit=20
)
office_renovation_thread = search_results[0]
# step6: Login to Todoist
todoist_password = next(item['password'] for item in passwords if item['account_name'] == 'todoist')
todoist_login = apis.todoist.login(username=profile['email'], password=todoist_password)
todoist_token = todoist_login['access_token']
# step7: Create Todoist task
task_title = f"Follow up: {office_renovation_thread['subject']}"
task_description = f"Email thread needs response. Thread ID: {office_renovation_thread['email_thread_id']}\nParticipants: {', '.join([p['name'] for p in office_renovation_thread['participants']])}"
task_result = apis.todoist.create_task(
    access_token=todoist_token,
    project_id=0,
    title=task_title,
    description=task_description,
    priority="medium"
)

task.query: Find the public playlist with the highest rating in my Spotify library that I haven't liked yet, then like it and add its first song to my song library.
task.ground_truth:
# step0: Get supervisor's account passwords
passwords = apis.supervisor.show_account_passwords()
# step1: Extract and use the Spotify password to log in
spotify_password = next(item['password'] for item in passwords if item['account_name'] == 'spotify')
spotify_login = apis.spotify.login(username='pa_ritter@gmail.com', password=spotify_password)
access_token = spotify_login['access_token']
# step2: Fetch all public playlists
public_playlists = []
page_index = 0
while True:
    playlists_page = apis.spotify.show_playlist_library(access_token=access_token, is_public=True, page_index=page_index, page_limit=20)
    if not playlists_page:
        break
    public_playlists.extend(playlists_page)
    page_index += 1
# step3: Fetch all liked playlists
liked_playlists = []
page_index = 0
while True:
    liked_page = apis.spotify.show_liked_playlists(access_token=access_token, page_index=page_index, page_limit=20)
    if not liked_page:
        break
    liked_playlists.extend(liked_page)
    page_index += 1
# step4: Identify public playlists not yet liked and select the one with the highest rating
liked_ids = {p['playlist_id'] for p in liked_playlists}
candidates = [p for p in public_playlists if p['playlist_id'] not in liked_ids]
best_playlist = max(candidates, key=lambda x: x['rating'])
# step5: Like the selected playlist
like_result = apis.spotify.like_playlist(access_token=access_token, playlist_id=best_playlist['playlist_id'])
# step6: Get the playlist's details to see its songs
details = apis.spotify.show_playlist(access_token=access_token, playlist_id=best_playlist['playlist_id'])
# step7: Add the first song from the playlist to the user's library
first_song_id = details['songs'][0]['id']
add_result = apis.spotify.add_song_to_library(access_token=access_token, song_id=first_song_id)

task.query: Find all my habit tracking notes from last week that show I didn't sleep over 7 hours, and create a new note summarizing which days I need to improve my sleep schedule.
task.ground_truth:
# step0: Get supervisor credentials
profile = apis.supervisor.show_profile()
passwords = apis.supervisor.show_account_passwords()
# step1: Get Simple Note password and login
simple_note_pass = [p['password'] for p in passwords if p['account_name'] == 'simple_note'][0]
login_resp = apis.simple_note.login(username=profile['email'], password=simple_note_pass)
token = login_resp['access_token']
# step2: Search all habit-tracker notes
import datetime
notes = []
page_idx = 0
while True:
    page = apis.simple_note.search_notes(access_token=token, tags=['habit-tracker'], page_index=page_idx)
    if not page:
        break
    notes.extend(page)
    page_idx += 1
# step3: Filter notes from last week and find those with 'slept_over_7_hrs: no'
today = datetime.date.today()
week_ago = today - datetime.timedelta(days=7)
bad_sleep_days = []
for note in notes:
    note_date_str = note['created_at']
    if note_date_str.endswith('Z'):
        note_date_str = note_date_str[:-1]
    note_date = datetime.datetime.fromisoformat(note_date_str).date()
    if week_ago <= note_date <= today:
        detail = apis.simple_note.show_note(note_id=note['note_id'], access_token=token)
        if 'slept_over_7_hrs: no' in detail['content']:
            bad_sleep_days.append(note_date.strftime('%Y-%m-%d'))
# step4: Create summary note
summary_content = f"Days with insufficient sleep last week: {', '.join(bad_sleep_days)}. Need to improve sleep schedule on these days."
create_result = apis.simple_note.create_note(access_token=token, title='Sleep Improvement Summary', content=summary_content, tags=['habit-summary'])
# step5: Complete the task
apis.supervisor.complete_task(answer=f"Found {len(bad_sleep_days)} days with insufficient sleep: {', '.join(bad_sleep_days)}. Created summary note with ID {create_result['note_id']}.")

task.query: I want to organize my tax documents. Copy all PDF files from my file system's Taxes directory to a new folder called 'Taxes_2023_Backup' in the Documents directory.
task.ground_truth:
# step0: Get file system password
passwords = apis.supervisor.show_account_passwords()
fs_password = [p for p in passwords if p['account_name'] == 'file_system'][0]['password']
# step1: Login to file system
fs_login = apis.file_system.login(username='kat_simp@gmail.com', password=fs_password)
access_token = fs_login['access_token']
# step2: Locate and list all PDF files in the Taxes directory (federal and state subdirectories)
federal_taxes = apis.file_system.show_directory(access_token=access_token, directory_path='/home/katie/documents/financial/taxes/federal/', recursive=True)
state_taxes = apis.file_system.show_directory(access_token=access_token, directory_path='/home/katie/documents/financial/taxes/state/', recursive=True)
all_tax_files = federal_taxes + state_taxes
# step3: Create the backup directory
backup_path = '/home/katie/documents/Taxes_2023_Backup'
apis.file_system.create_directory(access_token=access_token, directory_path=backup_path, recursive=True)
# step4: Copy each PDF file, renaming to avoid name conflicts
import os
for file_path in all_tax_files:
    filename = os.path.basename(file_path)
    if 'federal' in file_path:
        prefix = 'federal_'
    elif 'state' in file_path:
        prefix = 'state_'
    else:
        prefix = 'tax_'
    new_filename = f"{prefix}{filename}"
    dest_path = f"{backup_path}/{new_filename}"
    apis.file_system.copy_file(access_token=access_token, source_file_path=file_path, destination_file_path=dest_path, overwrite=True)

task.query: I want to review all payments I've received from coworkers in the past year. First, get all my Venmo transactions where I was the receiver, then cross-reference those senders with my phone contacts who have the 'coworker' relationship to identify work-related payments.
task.ground_truth:
# step0: Get account passwords
passwords = apis.supervisor.show_account_passwords()
# step1: Login to Venmo
venmo_password = next((item['password'] for item in passwords if item['account_name'] == 'venmo'), None)
venmo_login = apis.venmo.login(username='siwhit@gmail.com', password=venmo_password)
# step2: Calculate date one year ago
import datetime
today = datetime.date.today()
one_year_ago = today - datetime.timedelta(days=365)
min_created_at = one_year_ago.strftime('%Y-%m-%d')
# step3: Fetch all received Venmo transactions from the past year
all_received_transactions = []
page = 0
while True:
    batch = apis.venmo.show_transactions(
        access_token=venmo_login['access_token'],
        direction='received',
        min_created_at=min_created_at,
        page_index=page,
        page_limit=20
    )
    if not batch or len(batch) == 0:
        break
    all_received_transactions.extend(batch)
    page += 1
    if len(batch) < 20:
        break
# step4: Login to Phone app
phone_password = next((item['password'] for item in passwords if item['account_name'] == 'phone'), None)
phone_login = apis.phone.login(username='7295077363', password=phone_password)
# step5: Fetch all coworker contacts
coworker_contacts = []
page2 = 0
while True:
    batch2 = apis.phone.search_contacts(
        access_token=phone_login['access_token'],
        relationship='coworker',
        page_index=page2,
        page_limit=20
    )
    if not batch2 or len(batch2) == 0:
        break
    coworker_contacts.extend(batch2)
    page2 += 1
    if len(batch2) < 20:
        break
# step6: Extract coworker emails
coworker_emails = [contact['email'].lower() for contact in coworker_contacts if 'email' in contact]
# step7: Filter transactions from coworkers
coworker_transactions = []
for transaction in all_received_transactions:
    sender_email = transaction['sender']['email'].lower()
    if sender_email in coworker_emails:
        coworker_transactions.append(transaction)
# step8: Calculate total amount
total_amount = sum(t['amount'] for t in coworker_transactions)
# step9: Complete the task
answer = f'Found {len(coworker_transactions)} payments from coworkers in the past year totaling ${total_amount:.2f}'
apis.supervisor.complete_task(answer=answer)

task.query: Check if my Amazon Prime membership is active, and if not, subscribe to the annual plan using my payment card ending in 1102, then download the receipt and save it to my file system.
task.ground_truth:
# step0: Get Amazon password from supervisor
passwords = apis.supervisor.show_account_passwords()
amazon_password = next(item['password'] for item in passwords if item['account_name'] == 'amazon')
# step1: Login to Amazon
login_resp = apis.amazon.login(username='timothy.whit@gmail.com', password=amazon_password)
access_token = login_resp['access_token']
# step2: Check if Prime membership is active
from datetime import datetime, timezone
subs = apis.amazon.show_prime_subscriptions(access_token=access_token, page_index=0)
current_datetime = datetime.now(timezone.utc)
end_date_str = subs[0]['end_date']
if 'Z' in end_date_str:
    end_date = datetime.fromisoformat(end_date_str.replace('Z', '+00:00'))
elif end_date_str.endswith('+00:00'):
    end_date = datetime.fromisoformat(end_date_str)
else:
    end_date = datetime.fromisoformat(end_date_str + '+00:00')
if end_date.tzinfo is None:
    end_date = end_date.replace(tzinfo=timezone.utc)
is_active = end_date > current_datetime
if not is_active:
    # step3: Get payment card ID for card ending in 1102
    cards = apis.amazon.show_payment_cards(access_token=access_token)
    target_card_id = None
    for card in cards:
        if str(card['card_number']).endswith('1102'):
            target_card_id = card['payment_card_id']
            break
    # step4: Subscribe to annual Prime plan
    sub_result = apis.amazon.subscribe_prime(access_token=access_token, payment_card_id=target_card_id, duration='yearly')
    prime_sub_id = sub_result['prime_subscription_id']
    # step5: Login to file system
    fs_password = next(item['password'] for item in passwords if item['account_name'] == 'file_system')

task.query: Can you check if any of my habit tracking notes from last week show I didn't exercise at least 30 minutes, and if so, send me a reminder text about it?
task.ground_truth:
# step0: Get supervisor's app passwords

simple_note_password = next(item['password'] for item in account_passwords if item['account_name'] == 'simple_note')

# step1: Login to Simple Note

page_index = 0
while True:
    notes_page = apis.simple_note.search_notes(access_token=access_token, tags=['habit-tracker'], page_index=page_index, page_limit=20)
    if not notes_page:
        break
    all_notes.extend(notes_page)
    page_index += 1
# step3: Find notes from the last week with 'exercised_atleast_30_mins: no'
from datetime import datetime, timedelta
today = datetime.now()
week_ago = today - timedelta(days=7)
bad_days = []
for note in all_notes:
    note_detail = apis.simple_note.show_note(access_token=access_token, note_id=note['note_id'])
    note_date = datetime.fromisoformat(note_detail['created_at'].replace('Z', '+00:00'))
    if note_date >= week_ago and 'exercised_atleast_30_mins: no' in note_detail['content']:
        title = note_detail['title']
        if 'for ' in title:
            date_str = title.split('for ')[-1]
            bad_days.append(date_str)
        else:
            bad_days.append(note_date.strftime('%Y-%m-%d'))
# step4: Send reminder text if needed
if bad_days:
    phone_login = apis.phone.login(username='8346699249', password=phone_password)
    phone_access_token = phone_login['access_token']
    message = f"Reminder: You missed 30-min exercise on {', '.join(bad_days)}. Try to fit it in today!"
    apis.phone.send_text_message(access_token=phone_access_token, phone_number='8346699249', message=message)

task.query: Find any albums in my Spotify library where I haven't liked the album but all its songs are downloaded, and add those albums to my 'Liked Albums' list.
task.ground_truth:
# step0: Get credentials
passwords = apis.supervisor.show_account_passwords()
profile = apis.supervisor.show_profile()
email = profile['email']
spotify_pass = next((e['password'] for e in passwords if e['account_name'] == 'spotify'), None)

# step1: Login to Spotify
login_result = apis.spotify.login(username=email, password=spotify_pass)
token = login_result['access_token']

# step2: Get all albums from library (paginated)
albums = []
page_index = 0
while True:
    batch = apis.spotify.show_album_library(access_token=token, page_index=page_index)
    if not batch:
        break
    albums.extend(batch)
    if len(batch) < 5:
        break
    page_index += 1

# step3: Find qualifying albums
albums_to_like = []
for album in albums:
    album_id = album['album_id']
    priv = apis.spotify.show_album_privates(album_id=album_id, access_token=token)
    if priv['liked']:
        continue
    all_downloaded = True
    for song_id in album['song_ids']:
        song_priv = apis.spotify.show_song_privates(song_id=song_id, access_token=token)
        if not song_priv['downloaded']:
            all_downloaded = False
            break
    if all_downloaded:
        albums_to_like.append(album_id)

# step4: Like qualifying albums
for album_id in albums_to_like:
    apis.spotify.like_album(album_id=album_id, access_token=token)

# step5: Complete task (optional)
apis.supervisor.complete_task(answer=len(albums_to_like))

# step0: Get the Gmail account password from the supervisor
passwords = apis.supervisor.show_account_passwords()
gmail_password = None

    if account['account_name'] == 'gmail':
        gmail_password = account['password']
        break
# step1: Log in to the Gmail account
login_result = apis.gmail.login(username='kyl_moor@gmail.com', password=gmail_password)
# step2: Get the email thread counts for each category using the access token
category_sizes = apis.gmail.show_category_sizes(access_token=login_result['access_token'])

total = inbox + outbox + spam
print(f'Total across these folders: {total}')

task.query: Send a payment request on Venmo to my roommate Chris McCoy for $87.50 for half of this month's utilities, then set a reminder alarm on my phone for 3 days from now to check if he's paid.
task.ground_truth:
# step0: Get all account credentials
creds = apis.supervisor.show_account_passwords()

# step1: Extract Venmo and phone passwords
venmo_pass = next(item['password'] for item in creds if item['account_name'] == 'venmo')
phone_pass = next(item['password'] for item in creds if item['account_name'] == 'phone')

# step2: Login to Venmo
venmo_login = apis.venmo.login(username='paul_mill@gmail.com', password=venmo_pass)
venmo_token = venmo_login['access_token']

# step3: Search for Chris McCoy in Venmo friends
friends = []
page_index = 0
while True:
    page = apis.venmo.search_friends(access_token=venmo_token, query='Chris', page_index=page_index)
    if page:
        friends.extend(page)
        page_index += 1
    else:
        break

# step4: Find Chris McCoy's email
chris = next(friend for friend in friends if friend['last_name'] == 'Mccoy' and friend['first_name'] == 'Chris')
chris_email = chris['email']

# step5: Create payment request to Chris McCoy
payment_request = apis.venmo.create_payment_request(
    access_token=venmo_token,
    user_email=chris_email,
    amount=87.50,
    description='Utilities split - May 2023'
)

# step6: Login to phone app
phone_login = apis.phone.login(username='3379617841', password=phone_pass)
phone_token = phone_login['access_token']

# step7: Get current date and time
current_datetime = apis.phone.get_current_date_and_time()

# step8: Calculate 3 days from now
from datetime import datetime, timedelta
current_date_str = current_datetime['date']
parsed_date = datetime.strptime(current_date_str, '%A, %B %d, %Y')
future_date = parsed_date + timedelta(days=3)
future_day_name = future_date.strftime('%A').lower()  # Convert to lowercase

# step9: Create alarm for 3 days later at 9:00 AM
alarm_result = apis.phone.create_alarm(
    access_token=phone_token,
    time='09:00',
    label='Check Chris utilities payment',
    repeat_days=[future_day_name],
    enabled=True,
    snooze_minutes=0,
    vibration=True
)

task.query: My phone contact for 'Laura' might be outdated. Find her current email by looking up her Venmo transactions, then update her contact in my phone with that email and mark her as a 'Friend' relationship.
task.ground_truth:
# step0: Get supervisor's account passwords
passwords = apis.supervisor.show_account_passwords()
# step1: Extract Venmo and Phone passwords
venmo_password = None
phone_password = None
for account in passwords:
    if account['account_name'] == 'venmo':
        venmo_password = account['password']
    elif account['account_name'] == 'phone':
        phone_password = account['password']
# step2: Log into Venmo and Phone
venmo_login_result = apis.venmo.login(username='jes.mill@gmail.com', password=venmo_password)
phone_login_result = apis.phone.login(username='3808719492', password=phone_password)
venmo_access_token = venmo_login_result['access_token']
phone_access_token = phone_login_result['access_token']
# step3: Search Venmo transactions for Laura's email
laura_email = None
page_index = 0
while True:
    transactions = apis.venmo.show_transactions(access_token=venmo_access_token, page_index=page_index, page_limit=20)
    if not transactions:
        break
    for tx in transactions:
        if 'receiver' in tx and 'Laura' in tx['receiver']['name']:
            laura_email = tx['receiver']['email']
            break
        if 'sender' in tx and 'Laura' in tx['sender']['name']:
            laura_email = tx['sender']['email']
            break
    if laura_email:
        break
    page_index += 1
    if page_index > 10:
        break
# step4: Search phone contacts for Laura and update
contacts = apis.phone.search_contacts(access_token=phone_access_token, query='Laura', page_index=0, page_limit=20)
laura_contact_id = None
for contact in contacts:
    if 'Laura' in contact.get('first_name', '') or 'Laura' in contact.get('last_name', ''):
        laura_contact_id = contact['contact_id']
        break
if laura_contact_id:
    update_result = apis.phone.update_contact(access_token=phone_access_token, contact_id=laura_contact_id, email=laura_email, relationships=['Friend'])
# step5: Complete task
apis.supervisor.complete_task()

task.query: I want to create a note in Simple Note with all my Spotify playlist titles and their creation dates, then tag it with 'music-collection' and pin it so it's easy to find.
task.ground_truth:
# step0 - Get credentials for Spotify and Simple Note
passwords = apis.supervisor.show_account_passwords()
spotify_password = None
simple_note_password = None
for account in passwords:
    if account['account_name'] == 'spotify':
        spotify_password = account['password']
    if account['account_name'] == 'simple_note':
        simple_note_password = account['password']

# step1 - Login to Spotify
spotify_login = apis.spotify.login(username='ron.harrison@gmail.com', password=spotify_password)
spotify_access_token = spotify_login['access_token']

# step2 - Fetch all Spotify playlists with pagination
all_playlists = []
page_index = 0
while True:
    page = apis.spotify.show_playlist_library(
        access_token=spotify_access_token,
        page_index=page_index,
        page_limit=20
    )
    if page and len(page) > 0:
        all_playlists.extend(page)
        page_index += 1
    else:
        break

# step3 - Format playlist titles and creation dates
playlist_info_lines = []
for playlist in all_playlists:
    title = playlist['title']
    created_at = playlist['created_at']
    date_part = created_at[:10]
    playlist_info_lines.append(f"{title} - created {date_part}")
playlist_info = '\n'.join(playlist_info_lines)

# step4 - Login to Simple Note
simple_note_login = apis.simple_note.login(username='ron.harrison@gmail.com', password=simple_note_password)
simple_note_access_token = simple_note_login['access_token']

# step5 - Create a note with the playlist info, tag it, and pin it
note_result = apis.simple_note.create_note(
    access_token=simple_note_access_token,
    title='My Spotify Playlists',
    content=playlist_info,
    tags=['music-collection'],
    pinned=True
)
print(note_result)

task.query: Check if I have any unread emails in my Gmail inbox from the last 3 days, then mark the most recent one as read and archive the entire thread.
task.ground_truth:
# step0: Retrieve Gmail password from the supervisor app
passwords = apis.supervisor.show_account_passwords()
gmail_pass = [p['password'] for p in passwords if p['account_name'] == 'gmail'][0]
# step1: Log in to Gmail to obtain an access token
login = apis.gmail.login(username='ca-smit@gmail.com', password=gmail_pass)
token = login['access_token']
# step2: Calculate the date from 3 days ago
from datetime import datetime, timedelta
three_days_ago = (datetime.now() - timedelta(days=3)).strftime('%Y-%m-%d')
# step3: Fetch all unread email threads from the last 3 days
page_index = 0
threads = []
while True:
    page_threads = apis.gmail.show_inbox_threads(
        access_token=token,
        min_created_at=three_days_ago,
        read=False,
        page_index=page_index,
        page_limit=20
    )
    if page_threads:
        threads.extend(page_threads)
        page_index += 1
    else:
        break
# step4: Identify the most recent thread (first in the sorted list)
if threads:
    latest_thread = threads[0]
    thread_id = latest_thread['email_thread_id']
    # step5: Mark the most recent thread as read
    apis.gmail.mark_thread_read(access_token=token, email_thread_id=thread_id)
    # step6: Archive the most recent thread
    apis.gmail.mark_thread_archived(access_token=token, email_thread_id=thread_id)
    print(f"Archived thread: {latest_thread['subject']}")
else:
    print('No unread threads in the last 3 days')

task.query: Check if I have any public playlists on Spotify that have zero likes and were created before 2023, then delete the oldest one.
task.ground_truth:
# step0: Get all available API descriptions for the Spotify app
apis.api_docs.show_api_descriptions(app_name='spotify')
# step1: Get the detailed specification for the delete_playlist API
apis.api_docs.show_api_doc(app_name='spotify', api_name='delete_playlist')
# step2: Retrieve all account passwords from the supervisor
apis.supervisor.show_account_passwords()
# step3: Extract the Spotify password and log in to obtain an access token
spotify_password = [password for account in passwords if account['account_name'] == 'spotify'][0]['password']
access_token = apis.spotify.login(username='jasonsimp@gmail.com', password=spotify_password)['access_token']
# step4: Get the specification for the show_playlist_library API to understand pagination
apis.api_docs.show_api_doc(app_name='spotify', api_name='show_playlist_library')
# step5: Fetch all playlists from the user's library using pagination
all_playlists = []
page_idx = 0
while True:
    page = apis.spotify.show_playlist_library(access_token=access_token, page_index=page_idx, page_limit=20)
    if not page:
        break
    all_playlists.extend(page)
    page_idx += 1
# step6: Filter playlists: public (is_public=True), zero likes (like_count==0), created before 2023-01-01 (created_at < '2023-01-01T00:00:00')
candidates = [p for p in all_playlists if p['is_public'] and p['like_count'] == 0 and p['created_at'] < '2023-01-01T00:00:00']
# step7: Select the oldest playlist from the candidates (if multiple, sort by created_at; if one, it's the oldest)
oldest_playlist = sorted(candidates, key=lambda x: x['created_at'])[0] if candidates else None
# step8: Delete the selected playlist
if oldest_playlist:
    apis.spotify.delete_playlist(access_token=access_token, playlist_id=oldest_playlist['playlist_id'])

if not account['is_premium']:
    plans = apis.spotify.show_premium_plans(access_token=access_token)
    # step4: Determine cheapest monthly plan (monthly vs yearly)
    monthly_price = plans['monthly']
    yearly_price = plans['yearly']
    # Compare effective monthly cost: yearly_price/12 vs monthly_price
    if yearly_price/12 < monthly_price:
        duration = 'yearly'
    else:
        duration = 'monthly'
    # step5: Get available payment cards
    cards = apis.spotify.show_payment_cards(access_token=access_token)
    # step6: Select a valid (non-expired) payment card (pick one with furthest expiry)
    # Assuming cards are sorted, pick the first one that works; in simulation, card with expiry 2024-03 worked
    valid_card = None
    for card in cards:
        if card['expiry_year'] > 2023 or (card['expiry_year'] == 2023 and card['expiry_month'] > 6):
            valid_card = card
            break
    if not valid_card:
        valid_card = cards[2]  # fallback to card with ID 466 (index 2) as in successful attempt
    # step7: Subscribe to premium plan
    subscription_result = apis.spotify.subscribe_premium(
        access_token=access_token,
        payment_card_id=valid_card['payment_card_id'],
        duration=duration
    )
    # step8: Verify subscription succeeded
    account = apis.spotify.show_account(access_token=access_token)
    print(f'Premium subscription successful: {account["is_premium"]}')
else:
    print('Account is already premium.')

task.query: I want to review all songs I've liked on Spotify that have a duration over 4 minutes, create a new playlist called 'Long Favorites', add those songs to it, and then share this playlist by making it public and giving it a 5-star rating.

task.query: Check my Spotify song library for songs added in the last month, and if there are fewer than 10, search for popular songs in the 'Pop' genre and add 5 to my library.
task.ground_truth:
# step0: Get supervisor's email for Spotify login
supervisor_profile = apis.supervisor.show_profile()
# step1: Get Spotify account password
passwords = apis.supervisor.show_account_passwords()
spotify_password = next(item['password'] for item in passwords if item['account_name'] == 'spotify')
# step2: Login to Spotify
spotify_login = apis.spotify.login(username=supervisor_profile['email'], password=spotify_password)
access_token = spotify_login['access_token']
# step3: Get all songs from the user's library
import datetime
all_songs = []
page_idx = 0
while True:
    chunk = apis.spotify.show_song_library(access_token=access_token, page_index=page_idx, page_limit=20)
    if not chunk:
        break
    all_songs.extend(chunk)
    page_idx += 1
# step4: Count songs added in the last month
current_date = datetime.datetime.now()
last_month = current_date - datetime.timedelta(days=30)
recent_songs = []
for song in all_songs:
    added_at_str = song['added_at']
    if added_at_str.endswith('Z'):
        added_at_str = added_at_str[:-1]
    added_at = datetime.datetime.fromisoformat(added_at_str)
    if added_at > last_month:
        recent_songs.append(song)
# step5: If fewer than 10 recent songs, add 5 popular Pop songs
if len(recent_songs) < 10:
    search_results = apis.spotify.search_songs(genre='Pop', sort_by='-like_count', page_limit=10)
    for i in range(min(5, len(search_results))):
        song = search_results[i]
        apis.spotify.add_song_to_library(access_token=access_token, song_id=song['song_id'])
answer = f'Found {len(recent_songs)} songs added in the last month, which is fewer than 10. Added 5 popular Pop songs to the library.'
apis.supervisor.complete_task(answer=answer)

task.query: Find all Spotify songs in my library that are over 4 minutes long (240 seconds) and remove them from my library.
task.ground_truth:
# step0: Get supervisor's Spotify credentials
passwords = apis.supervisor.show_account_passwords()
spotify_password = next(item['password'] for item in passwords if item['account_name'] == 'spotify')
# step1: Get supervisor's email from profile
profile = apis.supervisor.show_profile()
# step2: Login to Spotify
login_result = apis.spotify.login(username=profile['email'], password=spotify_password)
token = login_result['access_token']
# step3: Retrieve all songs from the user's library with pagination
library_songs = []
page_idx = 0
while True:
    page = apis.spotify.show_song_library(access_token=token, page_index=page_idx, page_limit=20)
    if page and len(page) > 0:
        library_songs.extend(page)
        if len(page) < 20:
            break
        page_idx += 1
    else:
        break
# step4: Filter songs longer than 240 seconds (4 minutes)
long_songs = [song for song in library_songs if song['duration'] > 240]
# step5: Remove each qualifying song from the library
for song in long_songs:
    apis.spotify.remove_song_from_library(access_token=token, song_id=song['song_id'])
# step6 (Optional): Verify removal by checking the library again

task.query: I want to see if I have any pending payment requests on Venmo from friends, and if the total amount owed is less than $50, automatically approve all of them.
task.ground_truth:
# step0: Get Venmo password from supervisor
passwords = apis.supervisor.show_account_passwords()
venmo_password = next(item['password'] for item in passwords if item['account_name'] == 'venmo')
# step1: Login to Venmo
login_result = apis.venmo.login(username='tr_solo@gmail.com', password=venmo_password)
access_token = login_result['access_token']
# step2: Get all pending payment requests
page_index = 0
all_requests = []
while True:
    requests_page = apis.venmo.show_received_payment_requests(
        access_token=access_token,
        status='pending',
        page_index=page_index,
        page_limit=20
    )
    if not requests_page:
        break
    all_requests.extend(requests_page)
    if len(requests_page) < 20:
        break
    page_index += 1
# step3: Calculate total pending amount
total_pending = sum(req['amount'] for req in all_requests)
# step4: Conditionally approve all requests if total < $50
if total_pending < 50:
    for req in all_requests:
        apis.venmo.approve_payment_request(
            access_token=access_token,
            payment_request_id=req['payment_request_id']
        )
    print(f'Approved all {len(all_requests)} pending requests. Total amount: ${total_pending:.2f}')
else:
    print(f'Total pending amount (${total_pending:.2f}) exceeds $50. No approvals made.')
# step5: Complete the task
apis.supervisor.complete_task()

task.query: Check if I have any Spotify playlists with exactly 7 songs, and if I do, create a text file in my File System named 'PerfectPlaylists.txt' listing the titles of those playlists along with their creation dates.
task.ground_truth:
# step0: Get credentials and log into Spotify
passwords = apis.supervisor.show_account_passwords()
spotify_pw = [p['password'] for p in passwords if p['account_name'] == 'spotify'][0]
spotify_login = apis.spotify.login(username='ch-burch@gmail.com', password=spotify_pw)
spotify_token = spotify_login['access_token']
# step1: Fetch all playlists via pagination
all_playlists = []
page_index = 0
page_limit = 20
while True:
    playlists_page = apis.spotify.show_playlist_library(access_token=spotify_token, page_index=page_index, page_limit=page_limit)
    if not playlists_page:
        break
    all_playlists.extend(playlists_page)
    page_index += 1
# step2: Filter playlists with exactly 7 songs
perfect_playlists = [p for p in all_playlists if len(p['song_ids']) == 7]
# step3: Log into the file system
fs_pw = [p['password'] for p in passwords if p['account_name'] == 'file_system'][0]
fs_login = apis.file_system.login(username='ch-burch@gmail.com', password=fs_pw)
fs_token = fs_login['access_token']
# step4: Create file with playlist titles and creation dates
if perfect_playlists:
    file_content = 'Playlists with exactly 7 songs:\n\n'
    for pl in perfect_playlists:
        created_date = pl['created_at'][:10]
        file_content += f"Title: {pl['title']}, Created: {created_date}\n"
    result = apis.file_system.create_file(access_token=fs_token, file_path='/PerfectPlaylists.txt', content=file_content, overwrite=True)
else:
    print('No playlists found with exactly 7 songs')

task.query: Find all transactions with Glen Moore on Venmo that are over $50 and create a note in Simple Note summarizing them with dates and amounts.
task.ground_truth:
# step0: Retrieve Venmo password from supervisor app
passwords = apis.supervisor.show_account_passwords()
venmo_password = next(item['password'] for item in passwords if item['account_name'] == 'venmo')
# step1: Login to Venmo
venmo_login = apis.venmo.login(username='vicpowe@gmail.com', password=venmo_password)
# step2: Retrieve phone password and login to phone app
phone_password = next(item['password'] for item in passwords if item['account_name'] == 'phone')
phone_login = apis.phone.login(username='8924356613', password=phone_password)
# step3: Search contacts for Glen Moore's email
page_index = 0
glen_email = ''
while True:
    page = apis.phone.search_contacts(access_token=phone_login['access_token'], query='Glen', page_index=page_index)
    if page:
        for contact in page:
            if contact['first_name'] == 'Glen' and contact['last_name'] == 'Moore':
                glen_email = contact['email']
                break
        if glen_email:
            break
        page_index += 1
    else:
        break
# step4: Fetch Venmo transactions with Glen Moore over $50
transactions = []
page_index = 0
while True:
    page = apis.venmo.show_transactions(access_token=venmo_login['access_token'], user_email=glen_email, min_amount=50, page_index=page_index)
    if page:
        transactions.extend(page)
        page_index += 1
    else:
        break
# step5: Login to Simple Note app
simple_note_password = next(item['password'] for item in passwords if item['account_name'] == 'simple_note')
simple_login = apis.simple_note.login(username='vicpowe@gmail.com', password=simple_note_password)
# step6: Create summary note
summary_lines = ['Large transactions with Glen Moore (over $50):']
for t in transactions:
    date = t['created_at'][:10]
    amount = t['amount']
    desc = t['description']
    if t['sender']['email'] == 'vicpowe@gmail.com':
        direction = 'Sent'
    else:
        direction = 'Received'
    summary_lines.append(f'{date}: ${amount:.2f} {direction} - {desc}')
note_content = '\n'.join(summary_lines)
create_result = apis.simple_note.create_note(access_token=simple_login['access_token'], title='Glen Moore Venmo Summary', content=note_content)

task.query: See what songs I've added to my Spotify library in the past month (since April 1st, 2023) and create a new playlist called 'Recent Favorites' containing those songs.
task.ground_truth:
# step0: Get supervisor profile to retrieve email
profile = apis.supervisor.show_profile()
# step1: Get supervisor account passwords
passwords = apis.supervisor.show_account_passwords()
# step2: Extract Spotify password
spotify_pass = next(item['password'] for item in passwords if item['account_name'] == 'spotify')
# step3: Login to Spotify
login_result = apis.spotify.login(username=profile['email'], password=spotify_pass)
access_token = login_result['access_token']
# step4: Fetch all songs from library added since April 1, 2023
recent_songs = []
page_index = 0
while True:
    batch = apis.spotify.show_song_library(access_token=access_token, page_index=page_index, page_limit=20)
    if not batch:
        break
    for song in batch:
        if song['added_at'] >= '2023-04-01':
            recent_songs.append(song)
    page_index += 1
    if page_index > 100:
        break
# step5: Create a new playlist named 'Recent Favorites'
playlist_result = apis.spotify.create_playlist(access_token=access_token, title='Recent Favorites', is_public=False)
playlist_id = playlist_result['playlist_id']
# step6: Add all filtered songs to the new playlist
for song in recent_songs:
    apis.spotify.add_song_to_playlist(access_token=access_token, playlist_id=playlist_id, song_id=song['song_id'])
# step7: Complete the task
apis.supervisor.complete_task()
